page.title: 19TWEEDMOUTH FESTIVAL
page.content: The Tweedmouth Feast was started in the 13th century by St.Boisil.It related to the annual festival of the Saint who was patron of Tweedmouth (and a Tutor of St.Cuthbert). The Feast commences with the Crowning of the Salmon Queen at the Jubilee Lamp in Tweedmouth.A procession of the Salmon Queen and her attendents starts from the Berwick Town Hall. They are transported on a cobble (the traditional salmon fishermans boat) over the Old Bridge to the crowning ceremony. After the opening of the Feast week many carnival activities take place, during which money is collected to provide Salmon supper for the Senior Citizens of Tweedmouth.Most of the Tweedmouth based companies enter a decorative float which tours the town playing music and collecting money.
